concise_definition: v. 奉献, 专心致志, 题献, 专用

definitions.explanation_en: To give time, effort, or loyalty to a particular cause, activity, or person, often with deep commitment and selflessness.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将时间、精力或忠诚奉献给某一特定事业、活动或人，通常带有深切的承诺和无私精神。
definitions.example_en: She dedicated her life to improving education for underprivileged children.
definitions.example_cn: 她将一生奉献给了改善贫困儿童的教育。

definitions.explanation_en: To set apart or assign something for a specific purpose, often in a formal or ceremonial way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以正式或仪式性的方式将某物指定用于特定目的。
definitions.example_en: The park was dedicated to the memory of the fallen soldiers.
definitions.example_cn: 这座公园被题献给阵亡将士的英灵。

definitions.explanation_en: To inscribe or address a book, composition, or work of art to someone as a tribute or honor.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在书籍、作品或艺术创作中题献给某人，以示敬意或纪念。
definitions.example_en: He dedicated his novel to his mother, who inspired his writing.
definitions.example_cn: 他将这部小说题献给启发他写作的母亲。

comparison.analysis: “Devote” 与 “dedicate” 非常接近，常可互换，但 “devote” 更强调持续投入时间或情感，语气更温和、日常；而 “dedicate” 常带有更庄严、正式或牺牲性的色彩，尤其用于重大承诺或公开仪式中。
“Commit” (承诺/投入) 强调做出决定并承担义务，常用于行为或责任层面，如 commit a crime, commit to a plan。而 “dedicate” 更侧重于情感或精神上的奉献，对象通常是抽象的理想、人或事业，而非具体任务。
“Consecrate” (使神圣化) 是宗教或高度仪式化的用语，指将某物或某人献给神灵或神圣目的，具有强烈的宗教或超自然含义。而 “dedicate” 虽可正式，但多用于世俗语境，如纪念、公益或个人奉献，范围更广。
